NewsDetails.TitleText: Amazon and Other Book Retailers Issuing Refunds in E-Book Publisher Settlement [Mac Blog]
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Amazon today notified customers they are eligible for a refund for books they purchased through the Kindle book store. The refunds were paid by publishers Hachette, HarperCollins, Simon & Schuster, Macmillan, and Penguin as part of a settlement agreement in ebook price-fixing lawsuits filed by State Attorney Generals and other class-action plaintiffs.

NewsDetails.ContentText:
Microsoft's Xbox one has always been more expensive than Sony's PlayStation 4. A recent price cut by some big-name retailers has changed that.
Microsoft's (NASDAQ: MSFT ) Xbox One has trailed Sony's (NYSE: SNE ) PlayStation 4 in sales since the two next generation consoles launched. One of the key reasons is that Sony's console had a pricing advantage.

NewsDetails.ContentText:
Last month, Amazon started hiding listings for certain products if they do not have a GTIN, better known as the Universal Product Code (UPC). Now eBay, Google and Walmart have endorsed a drive to help businesses obtain valid GTINs for products sold online.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Amazon, Salesforce, IBM dominate IaaS, PaaS cloud infrastructure segments, says Synergy
NewsDetails.ContentText: Amazon (AWS) ( Nasdaq: AMZN ), Salesforce and IBM ( NYSE: IBM ) have become the three companies to beat in the growing infrastructure as a service (IaaS) and platform as a service (PaaS) segments of the cloud market, according to Synergy Research's fourth-quarter 2013 report.

NewsDetails.TitleText: Amazon acquires rights to Yodel stake
NewsDetails.ContentText:
Delivery company Yodel will soon be part-owned by Amazon.
The Guardian reports that the retailer has been given the right to acquire a 4.2 per cent stake in the Hatfield-based firm for £8.7m, valuing it at £207m.
Yodel ships around 135m parcels a year and is the UK’s second largest delivery service behind the Royal Mail. It has over 5,000 vans and employs over 16,000 staff. ?
